Title:
Morphological traits, DELTA system and molecular analysis for
a new species of Gibellula from China
Keywords:
Araneogenous fungus, Numerical classification, Phenotypic
traits, Phonetic tree, Splits network
Abstract:
Gibellula clavispora, a new fungus collected in Changbai
Mountain of Jilin Province, China, was described and illustrated on the
basis of morphological traits, description language for taxonomy system
and molecular analysis. Gibellula clavispora is characterized by
cylindrical synnemata, Aspergillus-like conidiophores, obovoid metulae,
8.6â“10.8 Ã 2.2 Î¼m, clavate phialides, 5.4â“6.5 Ã 1.1â“2.2 Î¼m,
distinctly clavate conidia, and the absence of conidiogenous cells of
Granulomanus synanamorph.
